Recipie: Step 1: These are made just like any other quesadilla or grilled cheese sandwich. Step 2: Spray the bottom of a non-stick skillet with cooking spray and preheat. Step 3: When the pan is fairly hot place 1 Flour Tortilla in the pan. Step 4: Fairly quickly (because you want to get everything on before the bottom starts to brown) spread on a few tablespoons of sauce. Step 5: Then add a layer of Pepperoni (and anything else you like). Step 6: Then top with shredded cheese. Step 7: Top it off with the 2nd Flour Tortilla. Step 8: Just like any other quesadilla or grilled cheese let it brown then flip it over. If all of the cooking spray was absorbed you can spray on a little more, but you usually don't need to. Step 9: After both sides are browned and the insides are hot and melted take the "pizzas" out to cool. Step 10: Once cooled slice in 1/4 like a pizza and wrap snugly with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Step 11: Tips and Ideas. Step 12: My son is not super picky so I made these in batches and freeze and then take them out the morning of school and pop into his lunchbox. It is usually thawed and yummy by lunch time. If you freeze them you need to let the cool completely first the wrap them separately in plastic wrap and then aluminum foil to prevent ice crystals from forming.

Recipie: Step 1: Heat about 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet. Recipie: Step 1: Soak chicken in water and salt at least 2 hours in the refrigerator. Step 2: Mix buttermilk, eggs and Season All and dip chicken pieces in this mixture. Step 3: Combine 1 cup flour, 2 tbsp corn meal, 2 tsp dried oregano, and 2 tsp Season All in a bag. Step 4: Drop two pieces of dipped chicken in the bag at one time. Step 5: Shake to coat. Step 6: Place on wire rack to rest. Step 7: (I place wax paper under the rack to catch any flour that falls off.) Heat a shallow layer of oil or shortening to 360 F in a jumbo chicken skillet (cast iron is great for this job) or an electric skillet. Step 8: Place the chicken in the pan, trying not to crowd the pieces. Step 9: Cover for the first five minutes. Step 10: Check the chicken. Step 11: When golden brown, turn. Step 12: Cover for the next five minutes. Step 13: Remove cover and cook uncovered, turning occasionally, as needed for a total of an additional 20 minutes or until cooked through. Step 14: Watch carefully, and don't allow it to get too dark. Step 15: If it's frying too fast, reduce heat slightly. Step 16: NOTE- the key is to cover in the beginning to start the cooking process inside the chicken, but to uncover during the last part of the cooking time to get the outside nice and crispy and golden brown.
Ingredients: ['4 cups water', '3 teaspoons salt', '1 cup buttermilk', '2 eggs', '1 tablespoon Season-All salt', '1 cup flour', '2 tablespoons cornmeal', '2 teaspoons dried oregano', '2 teaspoons Season-All salt', ' vegetable oil or shortening (for frying)']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['whole chicken, cut into 10 pieces (2 legs, 2 thighs, 2 wings, 4 breast)', 'cups water', 'teaspoons salt', 'cup buttermilk', 'eggs', 'tablespoon Season-All salt', 'cup flour', 'tablespoons cornmeal', 'teaspoons dried oregano', 'teaspoons Season-All salt', 'vegetable oil or shortening (for frying)']

Recipie: Step 1: Heat 1 tbsp oil in wok; add chopped onions and stir-fry until onions turn a nice brown color, about 8-10 minutes; remove from wok. Step 2: Allow wok to cool slightly. Step 3: Mix egg with 3 drops of soy and 3 drops of sesame oil; set aside. Step 4: Add 1/2 tbsp oil to wok, swirling to coat surfaces; add egg mixture; working quickly, swirl egg until egg sets against wok; when egg puffs, flip egg and cook other side briefly; remove from wok, and chop into small pieces. Step 5: Heat 1 tbsp oil in wok; add selected meat to wok, along with carrots, peas, and cooked onion; stir-fry for 2 minutes. Step 6: Add rice, green onions, and bean sprouts, tossing to mix well; stir-fry for 3 minutes. Step 7: Add 2 tbsp of light soy sauce and chopped egg to rice mixture and fold in; stir-fry for 1 minute more; serve. Step 8: Set out additional soy sauce on the table, if desired.
Ingredients: ['2 1⁄2 tablespoons oil', '1 egg, lightly beaten (or more eggs if you like)', '3 drops soy sauce', '3 drops sesame oil', '8 ounces cooked lean boneless pork or 8 ounces chicken, chopped', '1⁄2 cup finely chopped carrot (very small)', '1⁄2 cup frozen peas, thawed', '4 cups cold cooked rice, grains separated (preferably medium grain)', '4 green onions, chopped', '2 cups bean sprouts', '2 tablespoons light soy sauce (add more if you like)']

Dish: THE BEST EASY BEEF & BROCCOLI STIR-FRY
Recipie: Step 1: In a bowl, combine 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 2 tablespoons water and garlic powder until smooth. Step 2: Add beef and toss. Step 3: In a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat, stir-fry beef in 1 tablespoon oil until beef reaches desired doneness; remove and keep warm. Step 4: Stir-fry onion in remaining oil for 4-5 minutes until softened. Add the broccoli and cook for 3 minutes until the broccoli is tender but still crisp. Return beef to pan. Step 5: Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger and remaining 1 tablespoon cornstarch and 1/2 cup water until smooth; add to the pan. Step 6: Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Step 7: Serve over rice and garnish with toasted sesame seeds (optional).

Recipie: Step 1: In a small sauce pan, melt butter and blend in flour. Step 2: Let sit for a minute. Step 3: Add all of cold milk, stirring with a whisk. Step 4: Season with salt and cayenne. Step 12: Bake uncovered for about 1 hour at 350°F.

Recipie: Step 1: Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 350. Step 2: Process tomato and onion in processor or blender until pureed and thoroughly smooth. Transfer mixture to measuring cup and reserve exactly 2 cups. Discard excess. Step 3: Remove ribs and seeds from 2 jalapenos and discard. Mince flesh and set aside. Mince remaining jalapeno. Set aside. Step 4: Place rice in a fine mesh strainer and rinse under cold running water until water runs clear- about 1 1/2 minutes.Shake rice vigorously to remove excess water.This step removes the starch from the rice so it will not stick. IF YOU OMIT THIS STEP YOUR RICE WILL NOT BE DRY AND FLUFFY. Step 5: Heat oil in heavy bottomed ovensafe 12 inch straight sided sautee pan or Dutch oven with tight fitting lid over low-medium heat about 2 minutes. (The recipe is very specific about this but I used a 10 inch dutch oven and it worked out fine.) Drop a few rice grains in and if they sizzle then it is ready. Add rice and fry stirring until rice is light golden and translucent, about 6-8 minutes. Be careful that the oil doesn't get too hot too fast or the oil will splatter. Step 6: Reduce heat to medium, add garlic and 2 minced jalapenos and cook , stirring constantly until fragrant, about 1 1/2 minutes. Step 7: Stir in broth, pureed mixture,tomato paste, and salt. Increase heat to medium high, and bring to a boil. Step 8: Cover pan and transfer pan to oven to bake until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender, 30-35 minutes.Stir well after 15 minutes. Step 9: Stir in cilantro, minced jalapeno to taste, and pass lime wedges separately. Step 10: Edited to add 6-15-05: If you can't get good fresh tomatoes you are better off using canned tomatoes. Don't use those awful hard and underipe tomatoes that are at most supermarket chains. Just be sure that the processed tomatoes and the one onion equals 2 cups. One the other hand- if you find that after processing your tomatoes and onions that you have less than 2 cups- simply add enough bottled salsa to make up the difference. Step 11: Edited 8-21-06: Do not skip any of the steps. It may seem stupid- but rinsing the rice to remove the starch is very important if you want fluffy rice. It will only take two minutes of your time but it makes the difference. Step 12: Edited 8-15-08: Leftovers are just as delicious the next day so this is a perfect dish to make ahead time for potlucks. This rice also freezes well. For Freezing Ahead: Cool, portion and freeze in a ziploc bag. To reheat from frozen: Place in a pyrex dish and warm in the microwave, stirring every 2-3 minutes until heated through. Step 13: You'll love this rice! Money back guarantee.

Recipie: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the egg, pizza sauce, bread crumbs and Italian seasoning. Step 2: Fold beef into mixture and mix well. Step 3: Divide meat mixture into 12 greased muffin cups. Step 4: Press mixture into bottom and up the sides. Step 5: Fill center with cheese. Step 6: Bake at 375°F for 15-18 minutes or until meat is no longer pink. Step 7: Serve immediately with additional pizza sauce and cheese if desired. Step 8: Or cool, place in freezer bags and freeze for up to 3 months. Step 9: Thaw in the refrigerator for 24 hours. Step 10: Heat in microwave on high for 2-3 minutes or until heated through. Step 11: Top with additional pizza sauce and cheese if desired.

Recipie: Step 1: Cook pasta according to the package directions; drain well, set aside and keep warm. Step 2: Cook celery and onion in butter in a large skillet over medium high heat, stirring constantly until tender. Add English peas, stir until warm. Step 3: Add cream cheese, milk, salt, and pepper; cook over medium heat until smooth, stirring occasionally. Stir in tuna and Parmesan cheese; cook until thoroughly heated, stirring occasionally. Step 4: Add pasta and toss well. Cover at low or warm heat until pasta is warmed up. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

Recipie: Step 1: In a saucepan with a good fitting lid bring water, salt and optional ingredients if desired to a boil. The salt and butter are simply for flavor. The vinegar keeps your grains separated and gives you a prettier dish. No one will taste the vinegar at all! Step 2: Add rice and stir. Step 3: Cover and reduce heat to low. You will know that your temperature is correct if a little steam is visible leaking from the lid. A lot of steam means your heat is too high. Step 4: Cook for 20 minutes. Step 5: DO NOT LIFT LID! Step 6: The steam that is trapped inside the pan is what allows the rice to cook properly. Step 7: Remove from heat and fluff with fork. Step 8: Serve!

Recipie: Step 1: Place all the ingredients in a saucepan over a high heat. Step 2: Bring to the boil, then reduce to a simmer for about 20 minutes. Step 3: Remove any scum that rises to the surface. Step 4: Increase the heat, turning the drumsticks frequently in the liquid, and cook until the liquid has reduced to a sticky glaze. Step 5: Arrange the chicken on a serving platter, remove the garlic clove and chili from the liquid, and spoon the glaze over. Step 6: NOTE It's a glaze rather than a sauce, so there's not a whole lot of it.

Recipie: Step 1: First measure out all your ingredients. Step 2: Now from the 1/2 of cup sugar take 1 tablespoon of the sugar & combine it with the yeast& warm water (you know you have the right temperature of warm water when it's the same temperature as the inside of your wrist). Step 3: I let my mixer bowl which is metal (kitchen aid) sit in a hot water bath while the yeast dissolves, 10 minutes. Step 4: After the yeast has dissolved (it's nice & foamy) add to it the rest of the sugar, salt & 3 1/2 cups flour. Step 5: Mix well (I use the bread hook). Step 6: Add egg (already beaten) & oil. Step 7: Slowly start mixing in most of the remaining 3 1/2 cups of flour. Step 8: The dough will become quite thick. Step 9: When the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl, turn it onto a floured surface& knead for approximately 10 minute. Step 10: Add only enough additional flour to make dough manageable. Step 11: Knead until dough has acquired a "life of its own"; it should be smooth & elastic, springing back when pressed lightly with your fingertip. Step 12: Place dough into a large oiled bowl turning the dough once so its oiled on all sides. Step 13: Cover with a damp towel & let rise in a warm place for 2 hours, punching down in 4-5 places every 20 minutes. Step 14: Now, I always write down what time I started so I don't forget when the 2 hours are up & set a timer every 20 minutes. (In the summer I let the dough rise on my balcony & in the winter in front of my oven where something is always baking, turning it every time I punch down the dough). Step 15: After the 2 hours, turn your dough onto your working surface. Step 16: Now comes the forming part. Step 17: For Shabbos I always make a 2 level braided challah which looks great & is really easy. Step 18: Prepare your baking sheet lining it with parchment paper. Step 19: Preheat oven to 375°F. Step 20: First, take a large knife & cut the dough in half. Step 21: Next, from each 1/2 now cut off a third & place the 2 thirds on the side. Step 22: Now, from the first half (where you've removed a third) divide the remaining dough into approximately equal thirds. Step 23: Roll each third out till its about 10-12 inches (I'm guessing I never measured it) & braid all 3 roll together pinching the top & bottom half together& turning them slightly under. Step 24: Place on baking sheet. Step 25: Repeat the same for other half. Step 26: Now take the first third you removed earlier& divide in 3, braid just like you did before& place on top of the already braided challah. Step 27: Repeat same for other third. Step 28: Now let the challah rise for 1/2 an hour. Step 29: After the challah has risen glaze with beaten egg & add mohn or sesame if you wish. Step 30: Almost done! Step 31: Put in preheated oven & let bake for exactly 25 minutes! Step 32: Turn off oven & leave Challahs in for exactly another 10 minutes! Step 33: Remove from oven. Step 34: Enjoy--you deserve every compliment you get!
Ingredients: ['3 1⁄2 cups all-purpose flour', '2 (1/4 ounce) packages dry yeast', '1 egg, beaten', '1⁄2 cup vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon salt', '1⁄2 cup sugar', '2 cups warm water (80 -90)', '1 egg, beaten', ' poppy seeds (optional) or sesame seeds (optional)']

Recipie: Step 1: Mix together first 6 ingredients. Step 2: Add chicken; coat well. Step 3: Heat oil in electric skillet to 375 degrees. Step 4: Fry chicken until lightly browned. Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 500F (This is NOT a typo, 500F is correct!) . Step 2: In a large bowl mix together the olive oil, hot sauce, salt, pepper, garlic powder & paprika. Step 3: Add the potatoes and stir to coat. Step 4: Add the potatoes to a greased baking dish. Step 5: When scooping the potatoes into the baking dish, leave behind any extra olive oil/hot sauce mix. Step 6: Add the diced chicken to the “left behind” olive oil/hot sauce mix and stir to coat all the chicken. Allow to marinate as the potatoes bake. Step 7: Roast the potatoes for 45-50 minutes, stirring every 10-15 minutes, until cooked through and nice and crispy on the outside. Step 8: Once the potatoes are fully cooked add the marinated chicken. Step 9: Once the potatoes are fully cooked, remove from the oven and lower the oven temperature to 400°F. Step 10: In a large bowl mix all the topping ingredients together. Step 11: Top the raw chicken with the topping. Step 12: Bake 15 minutes or until until the chicken is cooked through and the topping is melted and bubbly delicious. Step 13: Serve with extra hot sauce and/or ranch dressing.

Recipie: Step 1: Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper and dredge in flour. Set aside remaining flour. Step 2: Heat 3 tablespoons of butter over medium heat in large skillet and brown chicken on both sides. Remove chicken and keep warm. Step 3: Saute onion in same skillet until it begins to become clear. Step 4: Add wine and cook until liquid is almost evaporated, stirring to loosen browned bits (deglaze) on bottom of skillet. Watch closely- this happens fast! Step 5: Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in reserved flour until it becomes a thick paste. Step 6: Add tarragon, chicken broth and the cooked chicken. Cover and cook until tender. Step 7: Place chicken on a warm platter. Step 8: Add remaining butter and heavy cream to the liquid that is in the skillet and heat through. Step 9: Pour sauce over the chicken and garnish with a little more tarragon or some chopped fresh parsley or green onion if desired.

Garnish with parsley sprigs and lemon slices if desired.

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with two layers of foil, shiny side out. Step 2: Peel off tough membrane that covers the bony side of the ribs. Step 3: Season the ribs on both sides with salt and pepper. If using, divide the Hickory liquid smoke evenly over the ribs. Step 4: In a medium bowl, combine the light brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder and ground red pepper. Apply the rub to all sides of the ribs. Step 5: Lay ribs on the prepared baking sheet, meaty side down. BONE SIDE DOWN FOR GRILLING! Step 6: Lay two layers of foil on top of ribs and roll and crimp edges tightly, edges facing up to seal. Step 7: Transfer to the oven and = bake for 2-2 1/2 hours or until meat is starting to shrink away from the ends of the bone. Step 8: Remove from oven. Step 9: Heat broiler. Step 10: Cut ribs into serving sized portions of 2 or 3 ribs. Step 11: Arrange on broiler pan, bony side up. Step 12: Brush on sauce. Step 13: Broil for 1 or 2 minutes until sauce is cooked on and bubbly. Step 14: Turn ribs over. Step 15: Repeat on other side. Step 16: Alternately, you can grill the ribs on your grill to cook on the sauce.

Recipie: Step 1: Lightly oil grill& heat BBQ to medium. Step 2: Whisk egg in a bowl& add next 6 ingredients. Step 3: Add any of the “stir-ins” that appeal to you. Step 4: Crumble in beef& using your hands or a fork, gently mix together. Step 5: Handle the meat as little as possible – the more you work it, the tougher it gets. Step 6: Gently shape (don’t firmly press) mixture into burgers about ¾ inch thick. Step 7: Using your thumb, make a shallow depression in the centre of each burger to prevent puffing up during cooking. Step 8: Place burgers on the grill, close lid& BBQ until NO LONGER PINK INSIDE, turning once, about 6 – 8 minutes per side. Step 9: An instant read thermometer should read 160F. Step 10: Don't abuse your burgers by pressing with a spatula, pricking with a fork or turning frequently as precious juices will be lost! Step 11: Tuck into a warm crusty bun& add your favourite toppings.

Recipie: Step 1: Cut skinless smoked sausage in half, lengthwise, and then chop into 1/2 inch "half moon" cuts. Cook in a frying pan for about 15 minutes, turning frequently to SLIGHTLY brown. Step 2: Meanwhile, put cooked & diced potatoes in 2 quart casserole. Add cooked meat and give it a gentle toss. Step 3: Mix all remaining ingredients (except for shredded cheddar cheese & the paprika) in a saucepan over medium heat until warm, melted and smooth. (Use a whisk and stir constantly.). Step 4: Pour white/cheese sauce over potatoes and meat. Sprinkle shredded sharp cheddar cheese on top, and then sprinkle paprika evenly over the top. Step 5: Bake in preheated 350°F oven for 35-45 minutes (watch, until golden brown on top). Step 6: NOTE: You can substitute: 1/2 lb. hot dogs, sliced into 1/2-inch slices OR 1/2 lb. ham diced into 1/2-inch dices OR 12 oz. can of Spam diced into 1/2-inch dices, instead of the smoked sausage.
Ingredients: ['4 tablespoons butter', '4 tablespoons flour', '2 cups milk', '1⁄2 teaspoon salt', '1⁄4 teaspoon pepper', '1⁄2 lb Velveeta cheese, diced', '1⁄2 cup sharp cheddar cheese, shredded', '1 lb skinless smoked sausage (Eckrich is my favorite brand)', '1⁄8 teaspoon paprika']

Recipie: Step 1: Place sauce ingredients in a quart jar with a lid and shake to mix. If you make this ahead of time just refrigerate until needed, shaking it again when you are ready to use it. This also keeps your dirty dishes down. Step 2: Mix cornstarch slurry in a large bowl- the mixture will be strange but trust me it works. It will be VERY thick almost paste like. Add ALL the chicken pieces and stir to coat. Using a fork remove ONE chicken piece at a time and let the excess mixture drip off. YES even though the mixture has a weird consistency it will not stick like paste and the excess will drip off. Add chicken to the hot (350 degree) oil and fry until crispy. Only cook 7 or 8 chicken pieces at a time. You do not want to lower the temp of the oil by cooking too many at a time. You can use a simple cooking or candy thermometer to judge the temp of the oil. Step 3: Drain on paper towels. Want them extra crispy? Put them on a rack over a sheet pan. Keep warm- I just put them in the oven with the oven off. Repeating until all chicken is fried. Step 4: In a separate wok or large skillet add a small amount of oil and heat to 400 degrees. Again, a candy thermometer works great. (Want less dishes? You can just drain the oil after you fry all the chicken, leave a small amount (about a tsp) in the pan and use the same pan if you like.) Step 5: Add green onions and hot peppers and stir fry about 30 seconds. Step 6: Stir (or shake jar) sauce mixture, and then add to pan with onions and peppers, cook until thick. Some reviews didn't kniw what "thick" meant. Thick like the same sauce you get at a restaurant.you want it to just coat the chicken. If it gets too thick, add a little water or other liquid. The thickness of the sauce should be similar to what you get when ordering this at a restaurant. Step 7: Add chicken to sauce in wok and heat just until the chicken is hot enough for you. It may not even need a minute if you kept the chicken warm. The quicker you serve it the crispier the chicken stays. Step 8: Don't be scared by any negative reviews. It's not rocket science though if you have never cooked with a cornstarch slurry it may feel like an experiment. Trust yourself! You've got this! If you have any doubts reread the recipe and get everything in order before you start to cook. I promise you will thank yourself and maybe even me! Enjoy! Step 9: Oh it's great served over rice!

Step 3: Add flour to sauteed mixture, stirring well, cook one minute stirring constantly. Step 4: Combine broth and half and half. Step 5: Gradually stir into vegetable mixture. Step 6: Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thickened and bubbly. Step 7: Stir in salt and pepper; add chicken and stir well. Step 8: Pour into shallow 2 quart casserole dish and top with pie shells. Step 9: Cut slits to allow steam to escape. Step 10: Bake for 40-50 minutes or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly and cooked through.

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Step 2: Mix dry ingredients and beer. Step 3: Pour into a greased loaf pan. Step 4: Pour melted butter over mixture. Step 5: Bake 1 hour, remove from pan and cool for at least 15 minutes. Step 6: UPDATED NOTES: This recipe makes a very hearty bread with a crunchy, buttery crust. If you prefer a softer crust (like a traditional bread) mix the butter into the batter instead of pouring it over the top. Step 7: Sifting flour for bread recipes is a must-do. Most people just scoop the 1 cup measure in the flour canister and level it off. That compacts the flour and will turn your bread into a "hard biscuit" as some have described. That's because they aren't sifting their flour! If you do not have a sifter, use a spoon to spoon the flour into the 1 cup measure. Try it once the "correct" way and you will see an amazing difference in the end product. Step 8: I have had many email from you kind folks about using non-alcoholic beverages instead of beer. That is fine to do but I highly recommend adding a packet of Dry Active Yeast or 2 teaspoons of Bread (Machine) Yeast so that you get a proper rise. Step 9: The final result should be a thick, hearty and very tasteful bread, NOT A BRICK! ;). Step 10: Thank you all for the incredibly nice comments and those of you who left a bad review - learn to sift sift SIFT! You will be amazed at the results you get.
Ingredients: ['3 teaspoons baking powder (omit if using Self-Rising Flour)', '1 teaspoon salt (omit if using Self-Rising Flour)', '1⁄4 cup sugar', '1 (12 ounce) can beer', '1⁄2 cup melted butter (1/4 cup will do just fine)']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['cups flour (sifted)', 'teaspoons baking powder (omit if using Self-Rising Flour)', 'teaspoon salt (omit if using Self-Rising Flour)', 'cup sugar', '(12 ounce) can beer', 'cup melted butter (1/4 cup will do just fine)']

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat your oven to 450°F. Step 2: Combine the dry ingredients in a bowl, or in the bowl of a food processor. Step 3: Cut the butter into chunks and cut into the flour until it resembles course meal. Step 4: If using a food processor, just pulse a few times until this consistency is achieved. Step 5: Add the buttermilk and mix JUST until combined. Step 6: If it appears on the dry side, add a bit more buttermilk. It should be very wet. Step 7: Turn the dough out onto a floured board. Step 8: Gently, gently PAT (do NOT roll with a rolling pin) the dough out until it's about 1/2" thick. Fold the dough about 5 times, gently press the dough down to a 1 inch thick. Step 9: Use a round cutter to cut into rounds. Step 10: You can gently knead the scraps together and make a few more, but they will not be anywhere near as good as the first ones. Step 11: Place the biscuits on a cookie sheet- if you like soft sides, put them touching each other. Step 12: If you like"crusty" sides, put them about 1 inch apart- these will not rise as high as the biscuits put close together. Step 13: Bake for about 10-12 minutes- the biscuits will be a beautiful light golden brown on top and bottom. Step 14: Do not overbake. Step 15: Note: The key to real biscuits is not in the ingredients, but in the handling of the dough. Step 16: The dough must be handled as little as possible or you will have tough biscuits. Step 17: I have found that a food processor produces superior biscuits, because the ingredients stay colder and there's less chance of overmixing. Step 18: You also must pat the dough out with your hands, lightly. Step 19: Rolling with a rolling pin is a guaranteed way to overstimulate the gluten, resulting in a tougher biscuit. Step 20: Note 2: You can make these biscuits, cut them, put them on cookie sheets and freeze them for up to a month. Step 21: When you want fresh biscuits, simply place them frozen on the cookie sheet and bake at 450°F for about 20 minutes.
Ingredients: ['1⁄4 teaspoon baking soda', '1 tablespoon baking powder (use one without aluminum)', '1 teaspoon kosher salt or 1 teaspoon salt', '6 tablespoons unsalted butter, very cold', '1 cup buttermilk (approx)']

Dish: GROUND BEEF STUFFED GREEN BELL PEPPERS
Recipie: Step 1: Cut off the tops of green peppers; discard seeds and membranes. Step 2: Chop enough of the tops to make 1/4 cup, set aside. Step 3: Cook the whole green peppers, uncovered in boiling water for about 5 minutes; invert to drain well. Step 4: Sprinkle insides of the peppers lightly with salt. Step 5: In a skillet cook ground beef, onion and 1/4 cup chopped pepper till meat is browned and vegetables are tender. Step 6: Drain off excess fat. Add drained tomatoes, salt, Worcestershire, and a dash of pepper. Step 7: in a separate pot put water bring to boil add rice cook until rice is soft. if needed add more water. Step 8: add rice to beef mixture. Step 9: Stir in cheese. Stuff peppers with meat mixture. Place in a 10x6x2 baking dish. Step 10: Bake, covered in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. in the last 5 minutes add any remaining cheese to the top of the peppers.

Recipie: Step 1: Pre-heat oven to 200C/400°F. Step 2: Saute carrots in the olive oil until starting to get tender. Step 3: Add in the onions and saute for a minute or two then add the meat. Step 8: Add tomato paste, wine and Worcestershire sauce. Step 9: Let this reduce slightly then add the chicken stock. Allow to reduce down until you have a thick meaty gravy. Season to your taste. Step 10: Remove from heat. Grease an oven proof dish** (9x13 works for me, as does an oval baker) with butter and add the sauce. Step 11: Spoon or pipe the mashed potatoes over top. Step 13: Serve as is or with some crusty bread to mop up that yummy sauce!

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 420°F A reviewer has suggested spraying the baking pan with Pam - that sounds like a great idea! Step 2: Put all the ingredients into a baking pan large enough to hold them. Step 3: Season generously with sea salt and black pepper. Recipie: Step 1: In a frying pan, cook chicken and onion together in oil over medium-high heat until chicken is just done. Recipie: Step 1: ADDITIONAL ITEMS - Cast Iron Skillet, Spatula or Tongs. Step 2: Bring your 1 to 2 inch steaks to room temperature and use a clean cloth to remove excess moisture. Step 3: Move oven rack 6 inches from heating element. Step 4: Pre-heat oven and skillet by setting the oven to broiler for 15 to 20 minutes. Step 5: Rub steaks with olive oil, kosher salt and coarsely ground pepper. NOTE: Use any seasonings of your choice. Step 6: Once the skillet is pre-heated, pull out the oven rack and carefully lay steaks on the skillet. NOTE: Pan is Extermely Hot and will spit and splatter. Step 7: Close oven and sear the steaks for 3 minutes on one side, turn and sear the opposite side for 3 minutes. DO NOT USE A FORK TO TURN STEAKS! Step 8: Once seared, set the oven to 500F and cook using this Time Chart. Turn steaks half way through the remaining cooking time. Step 9: Rare (120-130F)1" 0-1 minute, 1 1/4" 2-3 minute, 1 3/4" 4-5 minute Step 10: Medium (140-150F) 1" 2-3 minute, 1 1/4" 4-5 minute, 1 3/4" 6-7 minute Step 11: Medium Well(150-160F) 1" 4-5 minute, 1 1/4" 6-7 minute, 1 3/4" 8-9 minute Step 12: Remove steaks from the oven and let rest for 5 minutes. Step 13: Serving on warm plates is recommended to maintain meat temperature. Step 14: I can not stress this tip enough -- Keep the fork in the drawer until ready to eat. Never pierce the meat during cooking.
Ingredients: [' kosher salt', ' fresh coarse ground black pepper', ' olive oil']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['steaks', 'kosher salt', 'fresh coarse ground black pepper', 'olive oil']

Recipie: Step 1: Sauté onion in butter. Set aside. Step 2: Cook melted butter and flour using a whisk over medium heat for 3-5 minutes or until you see a noticeable golden brown color in your pan. Step 3: Slowly add in the chicken stock and whisk again to combine. Simmer contents covered (stirring occasionally) for 20 minutes on medium heat. Step 4: Add the broccoli, carrots and the sauteed onions, into the pot. Stir, add the milk and half & half. Cook covered over low heat 20-25 minutes but do not bring to a boil. This may cause the milk to curdle. Step 5: Add salt, pepper & nutmeg. Note: you can purée half of your soup in a blender or with a handheld immersion blender if you choose however it isn't a requirement. Continue to cook the soup on low heat and slowly add the grated cheese a handful at a time and stir to avoid clumps. Once all the cheese has been added is melted, remove from heat, and serve immediately. Suggestion: serve with crusty bread or in a breadbowl. Step 6: Refrigerate leftovers after they have cooled and store in a airtight container up to 5 days in the refrigerator.

Recipie: Step 1: Set oven to 375 degrees. Step 2: Grease a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Step 3: In a large skillet cook the ground beef with onion, garlic and green bell pepper (if using) until beef is browned; drain fat. Step 4: Add in salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin and oregano and Parmesan cheese; cook stirring for 2 minutes longer; remove the skillet from heat. Step 5: In a bowl whisk together the cheese soup and milk; set aside. Step 6: Separate the crescent dough into 4 rectangles; press perforations together firmly. Step 7: Roll each rectangle to 8x4 inches. Step 8: Cut each rectangle in half crosswise to form 8 (4-inch) squares (use a pizza cutter for this!). Step 9: Spoon about 1/4 cup beef mixture into center of each square. Step 10: Lift 4 corners of the dough up over the filling to meet in the center; pinch and twist firmly to seal. Step 11: Place the squares into the prepared baking dish. Step 12: Drizzle the soup/milk mixture around the squares in the baking dish. Step 13: Bake uncovered for about 20-25 minutes, or until the crusts are golden brown. Step 14: Remove from oven and sprinkle the grated cheese over each square and return to oven for 5 minutes or until the cheese melted.

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat the grill. Step 2: Blanch the sausages in simmering water until just firm to the touch; drain well. Step 3: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil from the capsicums in a large pan and gently sauté the garlic and onion until they have softened but not browned. Step 4: Add the olives, the capsicums, the tomato cooking sauce and the seasonings. Mix well and cook until thickish. Then stir in 8 torn basil leaves. Step 5: While the sauce is cooking, pan fry the sausages in a thin layer of oil in another pan until they are golden brown. Step 6: Then cut the two baguettes into three pieces about the length of the sausages; make cuts in the centre (but NOT right through) and insert a sausage topped with the sauce inside each piece of the baguette. Step 7: Place on the sausage-filled baguettes on a baking tray, top with cheeses and grill until golden and bubbling. Step 8: Serve with a garnish of basil.

Dish: FLAT IRON STEAK WITH PARMESAN SAUCE

Recipie: Step 1: In a medium glass bowl, prepare marinade by mixing garlic, light olive oil, basil, salt, pepper, lemon juice and parsley. Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350. Step 2: Sprinkle lemon pepper on both sides of breasts. Sprinkle the lemon pepper to your own taste. Step 3: Using a non-greased 9"x13" glass baking dish place the chicken, and melted margarine (or butter) inside. Cover. Step 4: Bake for 30 Minutes. Step 5: Remove from oven. Remove chicken and set aside. Add one cup of long grain white rice, one can of chicken broth (or equal amount of bouillion). Stir together and cover tightly with foil. Step 6: Put pan back in the oven. Step 7: Bake 30 Minutes. Step 8: Remove from oven, and place chicken back inside. Step 9: Cook for another 15 minutes. Step 10: This update to the recipe (11/19/13) brings it back to its roots and eliminates the problems people were having with under cooked rice/overcooked chicken.

Recipie: Step 1: In a small sauce pan, heat sesame oil. Step 2: Stir in the green onion and garlic and cook, stirring, for about 1 minute. Step 3: Add remaining ingredients and heat on medium until reduced by half. Step 4: Sprinkle the tuna with the pepper, salt, and sesame seeds. Step 5: Rub into meat to create crust. Step 6: Heat cooking oil in a large skillet set over medium high. Step 7: Add the tuna and cook until almost the desired degree of doneness. Step 8: The tuna will continue to cook slightly after it is removed from the pan. Step 9: Two or 3 minutes on each side should result in a pink center. Step 10: Drizzle sauce over the tuna and serve immediately.

Recipie: Step 1: In saucepan cook onion in butter till tender but not brown. Step 2: Blend in flour and salt. Add milk all at once; cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Step 3: Add cheese, stirring to melt. Step 4: Stir in parsley and mustard. Step 5: Fold in potatoes and Frankfurters. Step 6: Place in a 1 quart casserole. Step 7: Cover and bake at 350 degrees for about 35 minutes or till heated through. Step 8: Prep time does not include cooking and cooling of the potatoes.

Recipie: Step 1: Combine all ingredients ,except meat, in a bowl then pour over chops. Step 2: Marinade for two hours. Step 3: Broil or grill.

Recipie: Step 1: Combine butter, garlic, salt, oregano and cayenne pepper. Step 2: Cut a 2-inch long pocket horizontally in chicken breasts, cutting deeply but not all the way through. Step 3: Put a tablespoon of the butter mixture into each pocket, being sure to get it all the way down in there. Step 4: In a large skillet, heat olive oil. Step 5: Cook chicken, skin side down, uncovered,until well-browned, about 10 minutes. Step 6: Turn chicken and cover skillet, then cook until chicken is cooked through, another 10 to 15 minutes. Step 7: Uncover, spread the remaining garlic-oregano butter on the chicken and turn chicken once more skin-side down. Step 8: Cover and brown for another 5 to 10 minutes.
Ingredients: ['1⁄4 teaspoon salt', '4 tablespoons butter, softened', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1⁄4 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '2 bone-in chicken breasts, with skin', '1 -2 tablespoon olive oil']

Recipie: Step 1: Place Dry rub ingredients in a large Ziplock Bag and mix well. Step 2: Rinse Pork Buttes and sprinkle heavily with the Dry Rub,& using a Knife, poke some holes over entire surface of the Pork. Step 3: Make sure Buttes are well coated with the rub. Step 4: Place in a large container covered with saran wrap and refrigerate Buttes for 8 hours or over night. Step 5: Add all the Sauce ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a boil, stirring constantly so it doesn't stick. Step 6: Let sauce cool and either pour into a Quart jar or some kind of seal able container. Step 7: This Sauce will Keep at least 6 Months if kept sealed and in the fridge. Step 8: 8 hours later or the next day, Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Step 9: Place Butts in the oven uncovered for 6 hours. Test to see if the Pork pulls apart after 6 hours. If not, continue cooking until it does. Step 10: Pork will be dark and crusty on the outside. Step 11: Inside will be moist and delicious. Step 12: After the Pork is Pulled, Pour your Sauce over it and mix well. Step 13: This makes a lot of BBQ and I usually Freeze Half. Step 14: Freeze up to 6 months. Step 15: Serve BBQ on a Bun or just eat it with a fork! Step 16: Enjoy!

Recipie: Step 1: Place roast into crockpot and surround with vegetables. Step 2: Combine beef broth and vegetable soup mix, then add to crockpot. Step 3: Cover and cook on LOW 6-8 hours or HIGH 3-4 hours.

Recipie: Step 1: Dissolve yeast in warm water (110 degrees) and sugar in large bowl; allow yeast to proof or foam (about 10 minutes). Step 2: Add salt, oil, and 3 cups flour; beat for 2 minutes. Step 3: Stir in 2 cups flour to make a stiff dough. Step 4: Knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Step 5: Place in oiled bowl, turn dough to coat all sides, cover and let rise until doubled. Step 6: Punch down and divide in half. Step 7: Shape dough into two long slender loaves. Step 8: Grease and sprinkle with cornmeal either a french bread pan or large cookie sheet. Step 9: Place loaves in pan and cut diagonal gashes on top of each loaf (I use scissors). Step 10: Cover and let rise until doubled. Step 11: Bake at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes. Step 12: Note: You can sprinkle or spray water on the loaves during baking if you want a really crunchy crust.
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon yeast', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon sugar', '2 teaspoons salt', '5 - 5 1⁄2 cups bread flour']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['cups warm water', 'tablespoon yeast', 'tablespoon vegetable oil', 'tablespoon sugar', 'teaspoons salt', 'cups bread flour']

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F Line your pan with aluminum foil and lightly brush with olive oil, or use a bit of cooking spray. Step 2: Combine parsley, garlic, lemon zest, and coarse salt on the cutting board. Finely chop, then combine with the breadcrumbs in a shallow plate. Step 3: Brush top of each fillet with olive oil. Press fillet into the crumb mixture. Place fillets in baking dish, crust-side up. Bake until firm, about 12-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of the fish. Serve with lemon wedges.
Ingredients: ['1⁄2 cup fresh parsley', '2 -3 garlic cloves', '1 lemon, zest of', '3⁄4 teaspoon coarse salt', '4 (6 -8 ounce) cod fish fillets', ' olive oil']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['cups plain breadcrumbs', 'cup fresh parsley', 'garlic cloves', 'lemon, zest of', 'teaspoon coarse salt', '(6 -8 ounce) cod fish fillets', 'olive oil']

Recipie: Step 1: DO NOT USE A GLASS PAN FOR THIS RECIPE. Step 2: Pre-Heat the oven to 500 degrees. Step 3: Prep the roast by making 4-5 slits in the roast and filling the holes with salt, pepper and 1/2 of a clove of Garlic. Step 4: Now Salt and Pepper the rest of the roast. Step 5: Put the Roast in the oven and sear for 20 minutes. Step 6: Then add the water, the chopped onion and reduce the temperature to 275 degrees. Step 7: Cook for 20 minutes per lb. I like mine rare so that is what you will get if you cook for this period of time.
Ingredients: ['3 garlic cloves', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 tablespoon pepper', '1 onion', '1 cup water']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['(4 lb) rump roast (room temp.)', 'garlic cloves', 'tablespoon salt', 'tablespoon pepper', 'onion', 'cup water']

Recipie: Step 1: ------------Selecting the corned beef brisket------------. Step 2: Go to the store several days ahead of time or you will have to pick out the best of what has been picked over again and again. The best will disappear first. Step 3: Do not freeze. Step 4: Pick out a nice thick slab checking the sides to make sure it isn't a very gristly one. Step 5: Feel it because some butchers fold it over hiding the gristle if there is a lot of it. Step 6: There will always be some gristle and it runs the length of the slab in the center. Step 7: The thicker the slab the better. If you are lucky, you may see some chunk style at a higher price per pound. Step 8: If there isn't a spice bag in with the brisket, you will need to get some whole peppercorns (white and black) and bay leaves. Step 9: ------------Selecting the Cabbage-------------------. Step 10: The heavier and more solid it is, the better it is. Step 11: Smell it to make sure it isn't too bitter. Step 12: You may have to go to another store if the whole batch has a very strong bitter smell. I have had to visit several stores to find a decent batch. Step 13: Keep in mind that the outer leaves will be discarded even if the store has already removed the natural outer leaves to make them look better and fresher. Step 14: --------------Selecting the Potatoes----------------. Step 15: Watch out for the red dyed ones. Step 16: Pick out a bag of medium to small sized ones. Step 17: The smaller the better. Step 18: If you are lucky enough to find the ones as small as salad tomatoes, they are the best. Step 19: -------------Selecting the Carrots----------. Step 20: Get the smallest bag they have unless you like carrots, because you will only use one per pot of cabbage to take any bitterness out of the cabbage. Step 21: Serving a bowl of carrots is a big no no on Saint Patrick's Day. Step 22: Preparing and cooking the meal-----------------------. Step 23: (It's going to take 3 hours with you there). Step 24: Use a large Dutch oven or stock pot that will hold everything all at once. Step 25: Place the brisket (best side up) in the bottom of the pot. Step 26: There's no need to rinse it because nothing bad will survive what you are about to do to it and you will remove the outer marinate. Step 27: Add the spice packet or a teaspoonful of peppercorns and two bay leaves. Step 28: Cover the brisket generously with water and a bottle of beer (optional - adds flavor and is a tenderizer). Step 29: Bring to a boil. Step 30: Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 2 hours. Step 31: During the 2 hours------------------------. Step 32: Scrub and rinse the new red potatoes. Step 33: Remove any eyes and bad spots. Step 34: Leave as much of the peel as you can. Step 35: Quarter them (halve or whole if tiny). Step 36: Cover with water until ready for them. Step 37: Remove the outer leaves from the cabbage until the leaves are entirely light green, rinse and cut it into quarters through the spine so they stay together. Set aside. Step 38: Peel one carrot and cut it into quarters. Set aside. Step 39: Peel the onion and cut it into eighths. Set aside. Step 40: Rinse the bunch of fresh parsley and chop up just the tops into very tiny pieces. Step 41: I find that kitchen scissors do just fine. Step 42: After the 2 hours----------------------. Step 43: Add the potatoes on top of the brisket. Step 44: Add water to cover everything. Step 45: Bring to a boil. Step 46: Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Step 47: Add the cabbage on top of the potatoes and add onion and carrot on top of the cabbage. Step 48: Add water to cover everything. Step 49: Bring to a boil. Step 50: Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Step 51: Check the cabbage to see if it is tender. Step 52: If not, simmer another 5 minutes. You shouldn't undercook it and it's hard to overcook it. Step 53: When done-----------------------. Step 54: In a large serving bowl where you can stir the potatoes, crush the garlic clove and rub the inside of the bowl with it. Step 55: Place the potatoes in the bowl while still piping hot and add (at least) a quarter pound of butter and add a handful (more is better than less) of chopped fresh parsley. Step 56: Gently stir until butter is melted, it coats all the potato pieces and the parsley is evenly distributed. Step 57: Put the rest of the parsley into a tiny serving bowl for those who want to add more to their potatoes. Step 58: As I said, more is better. Step 59: Slice the brisket cross grain. Step 60: Hope there is leftovers for breakfast. Step 61: See my March 18th Breakfast! It's a family tradition. We make sure we make enough to ensure leftovers for breakfast the next morning. Finely chopped fried corned beef and cabbage (the entire meal) and coffee is divine. We throw in any leftover parsley.
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon peppercorn', '2 dried bay leaves', '1 -3 head fresh cabbage', '1 -12 medium red potatoes', '1 (1 lb) bag fresh carrot', " fresh parsley (Dried won't do at all)", " real butter (margarine won't do at all. Besides, we now know that butter is better for us than any of the margari)", '1 fresh garlic clove', '1 medium fresh sweet onion', ' yellow mustard (whatever floats your boat)', '1 loaf rye bread (traditional) or 1 loaf irish soda bread (see my N .y. C. Irish Soda Bread recipe)', ' Harp lager beer (optional)']

Besides, we now know that butter is better for us than any of the margari)", 'fresh garlic clove', 'medium fresh sweet onion', 'yellow mustard (whatever floats your boat)', 'loaf rye bread (traditional) or 1 loaf irish soda bread (see my N .y. C. Irish Soda Bread recipe)', 'Harp lager beer (optional)']
Ingredients List: {'peppercorn', 'wont parsley', 'bag carrot', 'margarine butter', 'mustard float boat', 'loaf soda rye recipe bread', 'garlic clove', 'harp beer lager', 'potato', 'onion', 'bay', 'head cabbage', 'beef brisket'}

Recipie: Step 1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Toast the almonds in a dry skillet over a medium-heat heat, stirring frequently, until they are golden, about 3 minutes. Step 2: Cook the pasta according to the directions on the package. Three minutes before the pasta is ready add the broccoli to the pasta pot. One minute before it is ready add the snow peas and red peppers to the pot. Step 3: While the pasta is cooking, make the sauce. Place the almond butter, soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, chili-garlic sauce and three tablespoon of boiling water (from the pasta pot) into a large bowl and whisk until smooth. Step 4: Drain the noodles and vegetables, return them to the pasta pot, add the sauce and toss to coat. Serve garnished with the toasted almonds and scallion greens.
Ingredients: ['12 ounces whole wheat spaghetti', '2 cups broccoli, tops cut into florets, stems peeled and sliced thinly', '2 cups snow peas, trimmed', '1 red bell pepper, cut into 1 inch pieces', '1⁄2 cup almond butter', '1⁄4 cup reduced sodium soy sauce', '3 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '1 tablespoon chili-garlic sauce, such as Sriracha', '1 scallion, green part only']

Recipie: Step 1: In a medium mixing bowl, add the tomatoes, garlic, basil, vinegar, olive oil, cheese, salt and pepper. Step 2: Mix thoroughly and let sit for at least 15 minutes at room temperature to let the flavors marinate. Step 3: Slice the bread into individual pieces and spoon the mixture on top.
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons minced garlic (I use the kind in a jar)', '3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '1⁄4 cup grated parmesan cheese', '2 1⁄2 cups minced roma tomatoes (cut so fine its almost a paste)', '1⁄3 cup thinly sliced fresh basil leaf', '2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', '1⁄2 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon fresh ground pepper']

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350-375. Step 2: Halve raw spaghetti squash with a sturdy sharp knife, scoop out, and discard the squash poop with a spoon. Step 3: Place halves onto an oven safe cooking dish face up. Step 4: Clean head of garlic and thinly slice garlic, (the larger pieces of garlic brown nicely, and offer a wonderful layer of complexity to the dish). Step 5: Spread garlic into the bowl like shape of the squash, salt and pepper vigorously, drizzle with a 50/50 mixture of olive oil, and vegetable oil (get the oil everywhere inside the squash). Step 6: Place onto the upper middle rack of the oven for about 30-40 minutes. (You will know it is ready when the squash separates with little resistance from the skin). Step 7: Remove from oven, and place in coldest location possible for at least 20 minutes, before separating from skin. Step 8: Use a fork to scoop and separate squash strands, add any other ingredients you like at this point. Step 9: Parmesan, Romano, or Pecorino, Feta, are all excellent additions to this dish, as well as, meat, sausage, veggies, olives, the list is endless. Step 10: WARNING **** If you use a loose tomato based sauce DO NOT add it immediately to the squash; this makes the squash runny, mushy, and unpalatable. Instead garnish the dish with a little bit of sauce atop the squash, and then offer more sauce on the side, in a separate dish. Step 11: If you ever had it served this way you know what I mean. Step 12: You can also take any leftovers and add a little bit of flour, and make into patties and fry.
Ingredients: ['1 head garlic', ' salt', ' pepper', ' olive oil', ' vegetable oil', ' meat or cheese']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['spaghetti squash', 'head garlic', 'salt', 'pepper', 'olive oil', 'vegetable oil', 'meat or cheese']

Recipie: Step 1: Marinade chicken in teriyaki sauce for approx 10 minutes. Step 2: Prepare noodles according to packet directions. Step 3: Drain noodles. Add oil, seeds and onions, toss to combine. Step 4: Cook chicken pieces in a hot pan for approx 3-4 minutes or until cooked through. Step 5: Add chicken to noodles and toss to combine.
Ingredients: ['1⁄4 cup teriyaki sauce', '1 (400 g) packet hokkien noodles (use your favourite noodles)', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toated', '4 spring onions, finely sliced']

Recipie: Step 1: In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, rice wine, and sugar, stirring to dissolve. Step 2: Cook noodles in boiling water about 8 minutes, or until tender. Step 3: Drain noodles and rinse under cold water. Step 4: In a large deep skillet or wok, cook onion in oil for about 3 minutes. Step 5: Add the cabbage, carrot and ginger and cook until cabbage is softened, about 3-5 minutes. Step 6: Add the pork and cook for 2 minutes more. Step 7: Cover the mixture with noodles and pour the sauce over all. Step 8: Cover and cook for 3-5 minutes, the remove the lid and toss the mixture together until it is well combined. Step 9: Place on a serving platter and garnish with chopped scallions, if desired.
Ingredients: ['1⁄3 cup soy sauce', '1⁄3 cup rice wine', '1 1⁄2 tablespoons sugar', '12 ounces Chinese wheat noodles (udon noodles may be substituted)', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 onion, sliced thin', '1 lb napa cabbage or 1 lb savoy cabbage, sliced very thin', '3 carrots, grated', '1 tablespoon chopped ginger', '2 scallions, thinly sliced (optional)']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['lb lean pork loin, sliced thinly (against the grain)', 'cup soy sauce', 'cup rice wine', 'tablespoons sugar', 'ounces Chinese wheat noodles (udon noodles may be substituted)', 'tablespoons vegetable oil', 'onion, sliced thin', 'lb napa cabbage or 1 lb savoy cabbage, sliced very thin', 'carrots, grated', 'tablespoon chopped ginger', 'scallions, thinly sliced (optional)']

Recipie: Step 1: Place rice in a saucepan along with 1 tablespoon butter, 2 cups water, and 1 teaspoon salt. Step 2: Bring mixture to a boil, then cover pan, lower heat, and simmer for 40 minutes (do not lift lid during this time) or until rice is tender. Step 3: Allow rice to sit off heat, covered, for 5-10 minutes more. Step 4: Take 2 cups of the cooked rice and place in a mixing bowl along with 1 egg and 1/4 cup melted butter, mixing well (may use leftover rice for another use). Step 5: Preheat oven to 350°F. Step 6: Take mixed rice and press evenly in the bottom and sides of a 9-inch glass pie pan. Step 7: Blind bake rice crust for 15 minutes at 350F and then remove from oven until filling (the rice should feel a little dry and not excessively tacky). Step 8: In a small mixing bowl, blend together lightly 3 eggs, the buttermilk, heavy cream, chopped sage, salt, and pepper. Step 9: Place crumbled bacon in the bottom of the rice crust. Step 10: Top bacon with chopped zucchini, and then the peas, making sure filling is spread evenly. Step 11: Pour egg mixture over the top of the vegetables and bacon. Step 12: Sprinkle with grated cheese. Step 13: Dot with little pieces of butter. Step 14: Bake at 350F for 30-35 minutes or until top is domed, golden brown, and a thin knife can be removed cleanly from the center of the quiche. Step 15: Allow to stand 30 minutes before slicing and serving.
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 egg', '1⁄4 cup unsalted butter, melted', '1⁄2 lb bacon, cooked crisp', '3 large eggs', '1⁄2 cup buttermilk', '1⁄2 cup heavy cream', '1⁄2 cup zucchini, very finely chopped', '1⁄4 cup frozen sweet peas, thawed', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh sage', '1⁄2 teaspoon salt', '1⁄4 teaspoon pepper', '1 tablespoon unsalted butter', '1 cup grated gruyere or 1 cup swiss cheese']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['cup long grain brown rice (uncooked)', 'tablespoon butter', 'teaspoon salt', 'egg', 'cup unsalted butter, melted', 'lb bacon, cooked crisp', 'large eggs', 'cup buttermilk', 'cup heavy cream', 'cup zucchini, very finely chopped', 'cup frozen sweet peas, thawed', 'tablespoon chopped fresh sage', 'teaspoon salt', 'teaspoon pepper', 'tablespoon unsalted butter', 'cup grated gruyere or 1 cup swiss cheese']

Recipie: Step 1: In a medium bowl, mix the oats, milk, cocoa powder and sugar. Step 2: Mash one of the bananas and stir into the oats. Step 3: Divide between two bowls or mason jars and store in the fridge overnight. Step 4: In the morning, slice the other banana and top the oats with the sliced banana and chocolate chunks and serve.

Recipie: Step 1: Heat oven to 425°F. Step 2: Lightly butter a baking sheet pan. I use the spray. Step 3: Spread 1/2 teaspoon mustard on each slice of bread. Step 4: Layer between mustard sides of two slices of bread, 1 slice cheese, 2 slices ham, 2 slices turkey, and another slice of cheese. Step 5: Repeat to make four sandwiches. Whisk eggs, flour, butter, salt and pepper in a shallow dish until smooth. Step 6: Blend in milk. Step 7: DIP both sides of sandwiches into egg mixture until bread is lightly soaked. Step 8: Place on baking sheet; drizzle any remaining egg mixture over top of sandwiches. Step 9: Bake 8-10 minutes until bottom is golden brown. Step 10: Turn with wide spatula and continue baking 8-10 minutes or until second side is golden brown. Step 11: Serve warm dusted with powdered sugar and dip or spread raspberry preserves on sandwiches. Step 12: Garnish with fresh raspberries.
Ingredients: ['4 teaspoons honey dijon mustard', '8 slices thin deli sliced swiss cheese', '8 slices thin deli ham', '8 slices thin deli sliced turkey (I like smoked)', '3 large eggs', '2 tablespoons flour', '1 tablespoon melted butter', '1⁄4 teaspoon salt', '1⁄4 teaspoon black pepper', '2 tablespoons milk (low fat to try to keep it low in fat!)', ' powdered sugar, for dusting', ' raspberry preserves, for dipping']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['slices bread (I use challah)', 'teaspoons honey dijon mustard', 'slices thin deli sliced swiss cheese', 'slices thin deli ham', 'slices thin deli sliced turkey (I like smoked)', 'large eggs', 'tablespoons flour', 'tablespoon melted butter', 'teaspoon salt', 'teaspoon black pepper', 'tablespoons milk (low fat to try to keep it low in fat!)', 'powdered sugar, for dusting', 'raspberry preserves, for dipping']

Recipie: Step 1: Fifteen minutes before baking preheat the oven to 450°; have a pie plate or oven-proof skillet ready. Step 2: Whisk together the milk, flour, eggs, sugar and vanilla; put the butter in the pie plate or skillet and place the pan in the oven just until the butter is melted; with a brush coat the rim and entire inside of the pan. Step 3: Slowly pour batter into hot pan; bake for 20 minutes; reduce heat to 350° and bake another 8-10 minutes, until pancake is well-browned; remove from oven and sieve confectioners' sugar over the top; serve immediately with fruit spooned into the center of the pancake.
Ingredients: ['1⁄2 cup unbleached all-purpose flour', '2 large eggs', '1 1⁄2 tablespoons sugar', '1⁄2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter', "1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar", '1 1⁄2 cups thinly sliced fresh fruit, of choice (peaches, nectarines, strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, blueberries,mangoes, etc.)']

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Step 2: Chopped chilled butter into 1/4 inch pieces and mix in flour and salt. Add water until dough holds together loosely. Step 3: Shape into a 5"x5" disc and wrap in cling wrap; chill in refrigerator for 15 minutes. Step 4: Press dough into tart pan using "lift and pinch" method. Poke 3-4 times with fork. Line with parchment paper or tin foil, and fill with baking beads or rice. Step 5: Bake for 15 minutes, remove parchment and baking beads, then bake for an additional 5 minutes. Step 6: Set aside to cool. Step 7: Dice yellow onion and saute in olive oil until carmelized. Remove from heat. Step 8: Line bottom of tart crust with grated Gruyere cheese. Step 9: Layer bacon bits on top. Step 10: Once cooled, gently lay sauteed onions on top of bacon layer. Step 11: Whisk together egg yolks, egg, salt, pepper, and heavy cream. Step 12: Pour egg mixture into tart crust until filling approaches top edge of tart crust. Step 13: Sprinkle grated parmesan on top. Step 14: Cook tart in oven for 20-25 minutes. Step 15: Allow to cool before serving. Step 16: Dice onions and garlic. Use box grater to coarsley grate apple. Step 17: Saute onions and garlic in large sauce pan until onions are translucent (about 5 minutes). Step 18: Add in apple, vinegar, salt, pepper, and tomatoes. Step 19: Keep on low simmer stirring occasionally, for about 45 minutes until jam has paste consistency. Step 20: Remove from heat. Once jam has cooled, spread a thin layer in a ring on top of tart. Garnish with arugala (optional).

Recipie: Step 1: Prepare a glass baking dish (at least 8x10) by spreading butter along the bottom and sides. Step 2: In a bowl, mix eggs, milk, sour cream, chives, seasoned salt, hot sauce and salt and pepper and whisk until well blended. Step 3: Add 2 cups cheddar and 1 cup mozzarella cheese and tots to mixture. Mix well until all tots are coated and all ingredients mixed. Step 4: In small pan, cook sausage until just before done (sausage will finish in the oven), drain well and add to tot mixture. Step 5: Pour the mixture into your pre-greased baking pan and top with the rest of the cheese and the bread crumbs. Spread topping evenly. Step 6: Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until topping is golden brown.

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F Brush a sheet pan with the melted butter. Step 2: Whisk together the eggs, milk, cream, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt in a medium bowl. Step 3: Slice the banana bread into 1/2 inch to 3/4 inch slices. Step 4: Dip the slices into the egg mixture to coat and layer into the sheet pan. The bread should be slightly overlapping. Step 5: Pour any remaining custard over the banana bread. Step 6: Bake for 30-35 minutes, rotating the pan halfway through. Step 7: Meanwhile, add the ingredients for the cream cheese glaze to a bowl. Beat with a hand mixer until creamy and combined. Step 8: Drizzle the glaze over the French toast and garnish with sliced strawberries and bananas. Step 9: Serve any remaining glaze on the side.

Recipie: Step 1: Break eggs into a pan and add the cubed butter. Step 2: Stir over a medium heat until the eggs start to cook. Remove from heat continue stirring eggs for about 20 second. Return to heat, continue to stir eggs until they start to clump, remove from heat and add the creme fraiche. Return to heat stirring in crème fraiche. Step 3: Remove from heat when eggs are clumpy, but soft. Step 4: Season with freshly ground black pepper and garnish with a sprinkling of chopped chives.

Recipie: Step 1: In a tumbler or parfait glass, artfully layer 2-tablespoon portions of yogurt, cereal and fruit into the glass, continuing until ingredients are used up, or glass looks properly full and beautiful. Step 2: End with the fruit (for prettiness sake), sprinkle with sweetener OR leave it out, according to your tastebuds. Step 3: Enjoy! Step 4: VARIATION #1: use other-flavored yogurts to compliment OR contrast the fruit flavors; use your imagination. Step 5: VARIATION #2: other cereals work well too (Grapenuts, Muesli, flakes). Step 6: VARIATION #3: how about peaches or mangoes? Halved grapes, orange bits, canned fruit cocktail (drained); let your imagination go! Step 7: VARIATION #4: sprinkle in a few mini-chocolate chips, raisins, dried cranberries. Ymmm!
Ingredients: ['8 tablespoons granola cereal', '8 tablespoons berries', '1 tablespoon artificial sweetener (optional)']

Recipie: Step 1: You need a large nonstick deep sauté pan that has a cover. Sauté onions in olive oil until opaque and tender. Step 2: Add red bell pepper and continue sauteeing until it softens up. Step 3: Reduce heat to low. Add the fresh chopped tomatoes, cook until they are breaking apart. Step 4: With a slotted spoon, add the chunkiest parts of the contents of the "Pomi" - the majority of the sauce should remain in the carton. Add the jalapeno now also. Step 5: Cook for 30-40 minutes, partially cover, and stir every once in a while. If it starts to look dry, add some of the sauce from the carton, slowly , as you need it. Add the salt and pepper - I like a lot because I love salt on tomatoes. Step 6: The final product should be a thick sauce that just looks like a whole lot of tomatoes stuck together - with very little to no juice, that is about 1-1 1/2 inches high. Step 7: Crack open the eggs on top of the shakshuka, one by one, giving each their own space. The whites should overlap, but the yolk should be spaced about 4 fingerwidths from each other. My pan can fit 6-8 eggs very comfortably. Step 8: Cover tightly with a lid and simmer for 20 minutes.
Ingredients: ['4 extra large ripe tomatoes, chopped', '2 red bell peppers, diced', '1 large onion, diced', '1 green jalapeno pepper, finely diced', '26 1⁄2 ounces pomi brand chopped tomatoes (nothing works like this!)', ' kosher salt, to taste', ' black pepper, to taste', '6 large eggs (or as many as will fit on your sautÃƒ pan)']

Recipie: Step 1: Combine flour, sugar, matcha and baking soda in a large bowl. Whisk in the wet ingredients (milk, yogurt and egg) until the batter is smooth. Step 2: Heat a saute pan over medium-low heat. Brush the inside of a metal ring mold or cookie cutter (about 3 inches across) with oil. Add remaining oil to pan and place the ring mold in the middle of the pan. Fill the ring mold 2/3 of the way up with the batter and place a lid on the pan. Make sure that the lid does not rest on top of the ring mold. Step 3: Cook for 5 minutes, then remove lid and cook for 1 more minute (or until bubbles start to form on top of the hotcake). Carefully flip the pancake and ring mold and cook the other side for 5 minutes with the lid, then 1 minute without. Step 4: Remove from the pan and and run a knife along the inside of the ring mold to unmold the hotcake. Serve warm with syrup.

Recipie: Step 1: Combine all ingredients in small bowl. Step 2: Mix well. Step 3: Serve on top of toast, English muffins, waffles, bagels or fruit.

Recipie: Step 1: In a heavy skillet, brown sausage, breaking up with spatula. Step 2: Drain off excess fat; set aside. Step 3: In a saucepan, bring salted water to a boil and stir in grits. Step 4: Cover, reduce heat to low, and continue cooking for 5 minutes longer, stirring occasionally. Step 5: In a medium saucepan, melt butter; stir in flour, pepper and milk. Step 6: Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. Add cheese, stirring until blended. Step 7: Add sausage and half of the cheese sauce to cooked grits. Step 8: Pour mixture into lightly greased casserole. With back of a large serving spoon, make 4 indentations in grits. Step 9: Break an egg into each indentation. Step 10: Bake at 325° for 15 to 18 minutes, or until eggs are done as desired. Step 11: Reheat remaining cheese sauce to serve with grits and eggs.
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon salt', '2 1⁄4 cups water', '3⁄4 cup quick-cooking grits', '2 tablespoons butter or 2 tablespoons margarine', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1⁄4 teaspoon black pepper', '1 cup milk', '1⁄2 cup shredded cheddar cheese', '4 large eggs']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['lb pork sausage', 'teaspoon salt', 'cups water', 'cup quick-cooking grits', 'tablespoons butter or 2 tablespoons margarine', 'tablespoons all-purpose flour', 'teaspoon black pepper', 'cup milk', 'cup shredded cheddar cheese', 'large eggs']

Recipie: Step 1: Spray a microwave safe cereal sized bowl with the Pam. Step 2: Wash the spinach, pat it dry, remove the stems, and tear it into edible sized pieces. (1/2 cup is my guess, I usually just grab a small fistful.) Toss into bottom of bowl. Step 3: Either slice or dice the tomato and toss it inches Likewise with the bacon. Throw the cheese on top of that. (you can change any of the veggies to suit your tastes). Step 4: Beat the two eggs and milk in a separate cup lightly with a fork, pour over the mess in the bottom of the bowl (a lot of the stuff will float, especially the spinach and bacon). Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Step 5: Microwave on high for 3 minutes. (I don't know how many watts my microwave is--let it cook for about 20 seconds after the center puffs up even with the rest, and it should be done) Avoid overcooking or it will form a yucky crust of crunchy egg. The sooner you eat it, the fluffier it is. After 15 minutes of sitting, it will be cold, and about half of the size it was coming out of the microwave. I don't recommend letting it sit that long.
Ingredients: ['1⁄4 cup fat-free evaporated milk', '1⁄2 cup fresh spinach leaves', '1 roma tomato', '1 -2 slice turkey bacon', '1⁄3 cup shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese', ' Pam cooking spray', ' salt and pepper']

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a 12-well muffin tin with nonstick cooking spray. Place 5 tater tots in each well and bake for 20 minutes until tater tots are soft. Step 2: Remove from oven and use the bottom of a shot glass or your fingers to press the tater tots flat on the bottom and up the sides of each well. Bake until golden and crisp, about 15 minutes. Step 3: In a large bowl, stir to combine the sausage, Colby cheese, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, roasted red bell peppers, mayonnaise, sour cream, ranch seasoning and chopped scallion whites. Spoon the mixture into the tater tot cups, then return to the oven and bake until cheese is melted, about 6-8 minutes. Step 4: Remove the cups from the muffin tin and top each with a sprinkle of scallion greens and pinch chili flakes.

Dish: MAPLE CREAM CHEESE FRENCH TOAST CASSEROLE
Recipie: Step 1: Place the bread cubes in a buttered 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Step 2: In a bowl beat the softened cream cheese with sugar at medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth and well combined. Step 3: Add in eggs one at a time mixing well after each addition. Step 4: Add in milk, half and half cream, maple syrup and vanilla; beat until well combined. Step 5: Pour the cream cheese mixture over the bread cubes in the baking dish, using a fork or spoon gently lift the cubes so that they coat evenly with the egg mixture. Step 6: Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 8-24 hours. Step 7: Next morning set oven to 375°F. Step 8: Remove the dish from the fridge and let sit out at room temperature for 30 minutes. Step 9: Bake uncovered for about 45-50 minutes or until set and a golden brown colour. Step 10: Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve with maple more maple syrup. Step 11: Delicious!

Recipie: Step 1: In a large skillet add the sausage and cook until most of it is brown. Step 2: Drain and return to pan. Step 3: Add the grated potatoes, onion, and salt to the skillet. Step 4: Cook on medium heat until the hashbrowns are golden brown. Step 5: Push the mixture to one side of the pan and scramble the eggs in the empty space. Step 6: Once cooked, stir them into the hashbrowns. Step 7: Add the hot sauce, tomatoes, and cheese. Step 8: Stir well and serve immediately.

Recipie: Step 1: Cut the bagels in half and spread evenly with the Laughing Cow Cheese. Cut each half into eights and place cut side down in an 8X8 inch pan that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Step 2: In a small bowl, mix together the eggs or egg substitute, vanilla and maple syrup; pour over bagels and sprinkle with chopped pecans. Step 3: Cover the dish with foil, place in refrigerator overnight. The next morning, remove from refrigerator 30 minutes prior to baking and allow to stand on counter. Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees and place covered dish in oven. Cook for 30 minutes, uncover, sprinkle liberally with cinnamon sugar and bake an additional 20 to 30 minutes or until center is firm and surface is lightly brown. Step 5: Serve with warmed maple syrup.

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Step 2: Spray a 6 cup muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray and set aside. Step 3: In a small bowl, beat together the eggs and milk; salt and pepper to taste. Step 4: Divide the egg mixture evenly between the prepared muffin tins and place in preheated oven. Step 5: Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until eggs are set; immediately sprinkle with grated cheese. Step 6: Remove from muffin tin and allow eggs to cool completely. Step 7: Split the biscuits and top each with a slice of the Canadian bacon. Step 8: When the eggs are cooled, place one on top of each slice of bacon. Step 9: Wrap in foil and freeze until ready to enjoy. Step 10: When ready to reheat, place in the refrigerator the night before, in the morning, wrap in a paper towel and reheat in the microwave at 70 percent power for 1 minute or until heated, turning after 30 seconds. Step 11: Please note that the microwave times are only estimates. Each microwave is different.

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400F; line twelve muffin cups with paper liners. Step 2: Combine first 4 ingredients in small saucepan; stir over medium heat until butter melts; cool until mixture is warm to touch; beat in eggs. Step 3: Sift flour, sugar, baking powder and salt into large bowl; add milk mixture and stir just until blended; fold in blueberries (or raspberries). Step 4: Divide batter equally among prepared muffin cups; Bake until golden and tester comes out clean, about 15-20 minutes. Step 5: Variation: You can use raspberries instead of blueberries.

Dish: SUN-DRIED TOMATO, BASIL & BLACK PEPPER SCONES
Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven 400 degrees. Step 2: Stir together dry ingredients and herbs; first 7 ingredients. Step 3: Blend in butter to look like coarse cornmeal. Step 4: Stir in tomatoes. Step 5: Mix milk with egg; stir into flour mixture until moist. Step 6: Gentily knead 8 to 10 turns; then pat into 6" circle on ungreased baking sheet. Step 7: Cut 8 wedges and separate slightly. Recipie: Step 1: Mix all the ingredients together until thoroughly blended (it is best to use your hands or an electric mixer). Step 2: Form into about 4 dozen 1 to 1 1/2 inch balls and place on a cookie sheet or broiler pan. Step 3: Bake at 375°F for about 25 minutes. Step 4: Once they are cool, they can be sorted into individual zip bags and frozen for a grab-and-go breakfast. Step 5: NOTE: for Scotch Eggs, mold a bit of the raw meat mixture around a peeled hard-boiled egg (or eggs) and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

Recipie: Step 1: In a medium bowl, combine eggs, milk, and vanilla; beat well with a wire whisk. Step 2: Add pancake mix, beating until smooth. Pour mixture into a greased 13x9x2" baking dish. Step 3: Place bread slices in egg mixture turning slices to coat evenly. Step 4: Let stand for 5 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Step 5: In a large skillet, melt 1 Tablespoon butter. Add 3 slices of bread; cook over medium heat for 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Step 6: Remove from the pan and keep warm. Repeat the process with the remaining butter and bread slices. Step 7: Serve immediately with the Honey Pecan Topping. Step 8: Honey Pecan Topping:. Step 9: In a small bowl, combine the butter and honey, stirring until smooth. Step 10: Add nuts, and stir well.

Recipie: Step 1: Blend the cream cheese, butter and flour until well mixed; Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Step 2: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Step 3: Roll out the dough into a 1/4-inch thick square; Cut the rolled dough into 16 to 20 squares. Step 4: A little off center of each square, place 1 tablespoon guava paste. Step 5: Fold the dough over the guava paste, forming a triangle; Press the edges shut. Step 6: Place the pasteles onto a cookie sheet and sprinkle them with a thin layer of sugar. Step 7: Bake until the pasteles are evenly browned, about 25 minutes.

Recipie: Step 1: Blend all items together in a food processor or blender. Serve immediately.
Ingredients: ['1⁄2 cup crushed pineapple', '1⁄2 cup yogurt', '2 tablespoons honey (can sub agave nectar)', '1⁄4 teaspoon coconut extract', '2 -3 ice cubes']
Cleaned Ingredients: ['banana', 'cup crushed pineapple', 'cup yogurt', 'tablespoons honey (can sub agave nectar)', 'teaspoon coconut extract', 'ice cubes']

Recipie: Step 1: In a small bowl mix the yeast with the milk and sugar. Let sit until foamy, about 10 minutes. In a mixing bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook, combine flour and salt. When yeast is ready, add that to the mixing bowl. Step 2: Add the egg and butter. Begin to mix the ingredients into a soft, but not sticky, dough. (Add a little extra milk or extra flour, 1 tablespoon at a time as needed). Knead dough until smooth and elastic. Transfer the dough to a lightly oiled bowl, cover, and let rise until doubled in size, about 2 hours. Step 3: Punch down the dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for a few seconds. With a lightly floured rolling pin, gradually roll out the dough to about 1/2-inch thick. (When rolling dough, let it rest periodically to relax). Cut out into 3" rounds with a lightly floured biscuit cutter. Re-roll the scraps to make more rounds. Step 4: Place the doughnuts on lightly floured baking sheets, spacing them apart, and cover lightly with a dry towel. Let rise in a warm spot until doubled in size, about 20 minutes. Step 5: Using a deep fryer (or fill a heavy pot with 3" vegetable oil) and heat to 325°F Fry the doughnuts, a few at a time, until golden and puffed, 4-5 minutes, turning frequently using a slotted spoon. Step 6: Lift the doughnuts from the oil and place onto a cooling rack. Once cooled, fill a pastry bag using your filling of choice. Insert the tip into the end of each doughnut and pipe approximately 1-2 tsp filling into them. Dust with confectioners' sugar, coat with chocolate icing, or dip in glaze. Best eaten the same day.
Ingredients: ['1⁄2 cup lukewarm 2% low-fat milk', '1 tablespoon sugar', '2 cups flour', '1⁄2 teaspoon salt', '1 large egg, beaten', '1 tablespoon butter, melted and cooled', ' vegetable oil, for frying', ' fruit preserves (or pudding, cream filling, etc)', ' cinnamon sugar', " confectioners' sugar", ' chocolate icing']

Recipie: Step 1: Heat oven to 350 degrees. Step 2: Grease and flour bottom and sides of 9 or 10 inch springform pan. Step 3: Combine flour and 3/4 cup sugar. Step 4: Add the butter to the sugar-flour mixture and cut with pastry blender or fork until it resembles coarse crumbs. Step 5: Reserve 1 cup of crumb mixture. Step 6: To remaining mixture, add baking powder, soda, salt, sour cream, one egg and almond extract; blend well. Step 7: Spread batter over bottom and up sides of pan 2 inches (batter should be 1/4 inch thick on sides). Step 8: Combine cream cheese, 1/4 cup sugar and 1 egg; blend well. Step 9: Pour over batter in pan. Step 10: Carefully spread preserves over all. Step 11: Combine reserved crumbs and sliced almonds. Step 12: Sprinkle over top. Step 13: Bake 55 minutes or until filling is set. Step 14: Cool 15 minutes. Step 15: Remove sides of pan. Step 16: Serve warm or cool. Step 17: Refrigerate leftovers.

Recipie: Step 1: Note before you get started: Shredding or cubing the cheese depends on personal preference; the shredded blends into the pastry, but the cubed leaves little chunks of cheese throughout. I'm a Libra, so I do both. (shred half and cube half ,-) Step 2: Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C). Lightly butter a baking sheet or line it with parchment paper. Step 3: Sift the flour, baking powder, and salt together. Place in either a medium bowl or the work bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade. Cut the butter into the flour so that it is completely incorporated, using two knives, a pastry blender, your hands, or food processor until incorporated. Step 4: Beat 2 of the raw eggs and the cream together and add to the dry ingredients. Mix or process just to incorporate the eggs into the flour and butter; do not overmix. Dump the flour-and-butter mixture into a clean bowl. Step 5: Fold the cheese, scrambled eggs, and bacon into the flour mixture. It will be sticky and chunky. Stir and knead the dough as little as possible while distributing the cheese, scrambled eggs, and bacon throughout. Step 6: Transfer the dough to a well-floured work surface. Pat the dough into a rectangle about 12 x 4 x 3/4 inch high. Cut the dough into three 4-inch squares. Cut the squares on the diagonal to form six triangles. Place the scones at least 1 inch apart on the baking sheet. Step 7: Beat the remaining 1 egg with 2 tablespoons water and use this wash to brush the tops of the scones. Step 8: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove and serve warm.
Ingredients: ['4 teaspoons baking powder', '1⁄2 teaspoon salt', '5 tablespoons unsalted butter, cold', '3 large eggs', '3⁄4 cup heavy cream', '8 ounces cheddar cheese, shredded', '3 large eggs, lightly scrambled and broken up into pieces about 1 inch square', '6 slices bacon, partially cooked and cut into 1/2 inch-wide strips (you could also sub in ham, just add in amount that suits you)']

Recipie: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-inch deep glass dish pie plate with 1 tablespoon olive oil.
